fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
In versions before 7.3, the JQL suggestion will only appear after you press on the space bar manually. 
(i) For example, after completing {{project=JIRA}} and insert space, JQL will suggest the operators "AND", "OR" and "ORDER BY". Without the space, there will be no suggestion after the value. 

Since 7.3, space will be automatically inserted after every field, operator and value. 
(i) For example, after typing {{project= }} and select the project from the suggestion list, space will be automatically added after the project name and we see another list of suggested operators (see the attached _.gif_ file). The suggestion after the value is not always helpful. 

h3. Suggestion
After specifying the values, suggestions should appear based on user input (space). 
(i) For example, if I add a space after {{project = JIRA}}, then suggest "AND", "OR", "ORDER BY". Otherwise, do not suggest any operators as I only wanted to search for all issues in the JIRA project.
fields.summary: Suggested operators "AND", "OR", "ORDER BY" after specifying a value for the EQUAL operator is not very helpful

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using the Visual Option with Internet Explorer 11 causes Quick Search to be unusable
 Environment
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit any Issue. Add a Comment; make sure it is in "Visual" and Save
 # The Quick Search is now unable to be used. Text cannot be entered into the Quick Search unless the page is refreshed.

h3. Expected Results

No effect expected on other fields
h3. Actual Results

Quick Search box is read-only and will not accept input
h3. Workaround

Refresh page in Internet Explorer 11 by hitting Refresh or F5 or use a different web browser
fields.summary: Saving comment in Visual mode makes Quick Search read-only

fields.description: During the upgrade of JIRA the existing home folder prompt does not notify you to press Return/Enter.  This can cause confusion as other prompts appear to be more clear in the fact that you need to act in order to proceed with the upgrade.
fields.summary: Consistency in Prompting

fields.description: In working with customers, we have several use cases where we need to provide copies of JIRA issues.  Currently the Export to Print view includes options like the Activity Log that we would like to be able to exclude.  Please consider adding this functionality.
fields.summary: Provide Option to Exclude Fields from Export to Print View

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

Currently, it's not possible to know if a JIRA issue is included in a Confluence [Change Log page|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-report-blueprint-427623492.html#JIRAReportBlueprint-CreateaChangeLog] when the page is created. This is because the included JIRA issues will be represented either as links or in a table in the Confluence page.
h3. +Suggestion+

Make it somehow possible to recognize if a JIRA issue is included in a Confluence Change Log page.
h3. +Note+

Creating a Project Link between the JIRA project and Confluence space as in JRASERVER-65329 will display the Change Log activity in the issues' Activity tab. However the activity will be displayed in all issues no matter whether they're included in the page or not.
fields.summary: Ability to know if a JIRA issue is included in a Confluence Change Log page

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, JIRA does not support ExternalID based configuration when user would like to configure Epic Link from Epic and Story. The reason for this is because the ExternalID option only available for regular issue relation (Eg: Task -> sub-task).

Since Epic Link is a customfield, same configuration like ExternalID does not work it.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow ExternalID support for Epic Link so users can use similar configuration as Task -> Sub-task relation while mapping Epic -> Story using Epic Link


h3. Workaround 

User parameter like below to map Epic and Story:

{code:java}
{
        "fieldName" : "Epic Link",
        "fieldType" : "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link",
        "searcherType" : "com.pyxis.greenhopper.jira:gh-epic-link-searcher",
        "value" : "SSPC-60"
      },
{code}
fields.summary: Improve Epic Link import with JSON Importer

fields.description:
h3. Summary
It is currently not possible to obtain the list of custom field options for any particular custom field via REST API. It's possible to obtain a list via the following, but only options in the relevant context will be returned
{code} http://example.com:8080/jira/rest/api/2/issue/{issueIdOrKey}/editmeta{code}

h3. Suggestion
In addition to JRASERVER-28539, create an API endpoint to return list of custom field options regardless of context
fields.summary: Return all custom field options irrespective of context via REST API

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

When some issues in a JIRA project are included in a Confluence Change Log page, and there's a project link between the JIRA project and the parent Confluence space, the activity of the Change Log creation is shown in the Activity tab of all issues in the JIRA project.
h3. +Steps to reproduce+
 # Create an applinks between JIRA and Confluence
 # Create a Project Link between JIRA project (PROJ) and Confluence space (SPACE)
 # Create version 1.0 and issues PROJ-1 -> PROJ-10 in PROJ
 # Add 1.0 as Fix Version/s to PROJ-1 -> PROJ-5
 # Create a [JIRA Report of type Change Log|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/jira-report-blueprint-427623492.html#JIRAReportBlueprint-CreateaChangeLog] in SPACE -> Select PROJ and 1.0 as project and version respectively

h3. +Expected behavior+

The activity of the Release Notes creation is only visible in the Activity tab of issues PROJ-1 -> PROJ-5, which are included in the JIRA Report.
h3. +Actual behavior+

The activity of the Release Notes creation is visible in the Activity tab of all issues in the project (PROJ-1 -> PROJ-10 in this example).
h3. +Notes+

If the Project Link is removed, the activity is not shown in any issue, thus there's no way to know from JIRA if an issue is included in a Confluence Change Log. The Suggestion for this is JRASERVER-65332.
fields.summary: Project Link shows Confluence Change Log activity in Unrelated Issues

fields.description:
h3. Definition
For instance where users are using custom/in house plugins, UPM still checks those add-on in Marketplace (they obviously do not exist in there). As a result, it throws 401 unauthorized errors. 

h3. Suggestions
This can be avoided by:
# Having an option to disable this checks for built-in/custom add-ons
# Allow users to only query the Marketplace for plugins that you know that there is information about it.
# Change the request and do one query ahead of the others requesting marketplace information for all installed plugins; afterwards use the data returned to query the plugin information as usual
fields.summary: UPM checks for Plugins that Does not exist in Marketplace

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

Can a documentation containing a collection of  best practices for securing a JIRA instance be created similar to [this one|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/best-practices-for-configuring-confluence-security-216433533.html/?_ga=2.68524696.801198909.1495105182-524443449.1491459771] made for Confluence?

It would be a good source of information for most new JIRA admins attempting to secure their JIRA instance.

h5. Existing Documentation

At the moment we have documents that appear to be in bits and parts such as the ones below without any fully providing enough information:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/securing-jira-with-apache-http-server-720411724.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-configure-jira-server-applications-for-security-best-practices-785324598.html 
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/kb/integrating-apache-http-server-reverse-proxy-with-jira-753894357.html?_ga=2.144011836.801198909.1495105182-524443449.1491459771
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-802593051.html?_ga=2.144011836.801198909.1495105182-524443449.1491459771

h5. Feature Request

Can something similar to the confluence guide be compiled for JIRA?
fields.summary: Best Practices for Configuring JIRA Security

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When trying to Bulk Transition issues, the comment field does not allow users to be mentioned with it saying *Found no matching users for "username"* despite the user exists in the system and having access to the issues.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open the issue navigator or an existing filter.
# Select *Tools* > *Bulk Change* on the top right.
# Choose the issues to be bulk changed.
# Select the *Transition Issues* operation.
# Select which Workflow Action will be performed.
# Under the *Comment* section, attempt to mention an existing user that has access to the issues.

h3. Expected Results
The username will be able to be successfully added as a mention

h3. Actual Results
The UI will mention *Found no matching users for "username"* and the user is unable to be mentioned.

h3.Workaround
Use the bulk *Edit Issues* operation instead to mention users instead, as the user mentions are working for this operation.
fields.summary: Unable to mention users when trying to add comment in the Bulk Transition Issues screen

See image
fields.summary: Allow all Text Fields to have Formatting Options Tool Bar

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In JIRA Instance Health ver *2.1.21* the index health check for JIRA Data Center instances was disabled.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement Lucene status and consistency check
h3. Workaround
 * Run empty JQL manually at each node
 * Check number of row in {{jiraissue}} table

h5. New REST API
As part of JIRA 7.2.10 there is a new REST API available. 
REST endpoint:  GET {{<JIRA context>/rest/api/2/index/summary}}

Please see docs for details:
* REST Doc: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/REST/7.2.10/#api/2/index/summary
* Java Doc: https://docs.atlassian.com/jira/7.2.10/com/atlassian/jira/index/summary/IndexSummarizer.html
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want check Lucene status and consistency

fields.description:
h5. Summary

If a user changes the name of a field in JIRA, they would need to change all filters that make use of this field so they can work again and in a case where there are a lot or if other users or add-ons make use of such fields for reporting, this can be a very cumbersome work to update all filters.

h5. Suggestion

Can the field id be used instead of the field name when performing the search and saving it to filter so that even if the name changes, the id stays the same?

h5. Existing Behavior

The user would need to manually modify each filter to make the change.
fields.summary: Save Field id instead of name for Filters

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Customer has difficulties to navigate through Create issue screen using the screen reader (NVDA) after clicking on "Create issue in epic" link.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Activate NVDA
# Click on “create issue in epic” link
# Tab to change from the “summary” input field, to the “due date”, “assign” input field and then to the “assign to me” link. 
# Continue to tab to the next field

h3. Expected Results
User should be able to hear the “description” input field and enter in the description of the issue and continue tabbing through this page until I hear the “create issue” link.

h3. Actual Results
When trying to tab out of the “assign to me” link, the reader can no longer read out the text correctly.
fields.summary: NVDA compatibility with “Create issue in epic” screen

fields.description:
h5. Issue Summary

When adds a Multi-Line Text field which has it's renderer set to the Wiki Style renderer on a new tab on a screen, JIRA fails to render the Visual and Text Buttons which in turn breaks how the field works.

Have a look at the image below:

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h5. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a multi-line text field.
# Associate this with a screen. (Recommend a create issue screen for a project for ease of testing)
# Go to Field Configuration page and change the field's renderer to Wiki Style render.
# Go to the screens page where the field is added.
# Create a new tab.
# Move the field created in step 1 to the new tab.
# Attempt to create an issue in the project in question triggering the screen.

h5. Expected Behavior

JIRA would render the field correctly.

h5. Actual Behavior

JIRA would render the field without the Visual and Text button options making it difficult for the user to confirm their styling is correct or not.

(!) This works correctly if the field is added to the default tab of the screen(Field Tab). Also, this affects system fields like the *Description* field.
fields.summary: Broken Multi-Line Text Field

fields.description:
The only plugin and one of the best plugins of any kind for JIRA the Syntax Highlighter is no longer being supported/updated so we are left with the Rich Text Editors Code macro. 

This macro is extremely basic and really needs to have at the very least programming Languages added. 

You should also add the highlighting as well.  

Both of those features make reading Code in Description and Comments much clearer.
fields.summary: Rich Text Editor Code macro needs languages added

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Add field to JIRA Datacenter Cloud Formation Template to specify the DNS name

Currently the JIRA AWS Cloud formation templates do not have a place to input the desired dns name. It would be nice to be able to define this while the instance is being created as this information could be used to populate the proxyname and proxy port configuration, which will eventually need to be manually added on each instance.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install JIRA Datacenter using the AWS Cloudformation quick start
# Add a cname record and point it to the AWS load balancer 

h3. Expected Results
Gadgets and other items that are rendered by a "self-connection" work

h3. Actual Results
Gadget titles and other items rendered by making a self-connection will not work properly


h3.Workaround
Manually ssh into each node and set the proxyname parameter in setenv.sh, and restart the instance.
fields.summary: Add field to JIRA Datacenter Cloud Formation Template to specify the DNS name

fields.description:
h4. Problem
Attempting to delete a field value from an issue does not work, see attached video: [^RemoveSprint.mov]. In this situation with the Sprint field, users are then unable to properly work/schedule tickets.

h5. Expected Result
* The field value is removed
* Or there is an error/message indicating why it was not

h5. Actual Result
Field value is not updated and there is no indication anywhere as to why it failed. No errors in logs or UI.

h4. Cause
The cause is because the field is shown on multiple tabs within a single screen, see the configuration:
| !screentab1.png|thumbnail! | !screentab2.png|thumbnail! |

It is not clear how it got into this state, as JIRA prevents an admin from adding the same field to multiple screens. Still, we've received multiple reports of this happening to the "Sprint" and Epic fields.

h4. Resolution
To fix this, remove the Sprint field from *both* screen tabs and then add it back to the appropriate tab.
fields.summary: Attempting to Remove Value for Issue Field Does Not Work

fields.description:
h3. Summary

User unable to add customfield in the notification by following steps in https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/Adding+Custom+Fields+to+Email

JIRA 7.2.0, 7.3.0, 7.3.6


h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

JIRA not showing the customfield added in the Velocity Template in notification.

* The same steps works when used in JIRA 6


h3.Workaround

None
fields.summary: Include Customfield in Notification

fields.description:
Hello,

We do have good documentation for the config.sh working as GUI tool.
Though we don't have any mention to the commandline options used within the tool.
It is quite likely to have an OS like Linux that have no X-Server running and we need to only use the commandline interface in that case.

It would be good if we create a parallel article to the one at: https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/using-the-jira-application-configuration-tool-802593165.html
that would describe the command line options.
fields.summary: Need to create an article to describe JIRA config.sh commandline arguments and options

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Paste URL mixed with cyrillic symbols into issue comment -
https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Регистрационные_знаки_транспортных_средств_в_России. 
Only part with latin symbols will be handled as URL.


h3. Environment
JIRA 7.3.6
Windows 8.1
Chrome,IE 11 and Firefox.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Install new vanilla instance of JIRA 7.3.6
* create a project and then create an issue in it.
* try to add a comment in the issue, use the Text tab to add it
* Paste any of the following URLs in the comment text tab and add it
** https://ar.wikipedia.org/wiki/بوابة:مصر
** https://ru.wikipedia.org/wiki/Регистрационные_знаки_транспортных_средств_в_России

h3. Expected Results
JIRA should render the full URL as a link in the visual view.
Also the link should work pointing to the right page


h3. Actual Results
Only Latin portion of the URL is rendered and the rest of the URL is not taken in. 
The link points to a top level URL not to the right page intended.

 
h3.Workaround
Copy the whole URL and paste into the browser, don't click the link.
fields.summary: URL mixed with cyrillic / Arabic symbols not properly rendered in rich text editor

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA should not display warning if only white space is entered to issue creation form upon canceling

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the create button to create an issue
# Do not fill any field
# Enter a single white space in the summary field
# Hit Cancel


h3. Expected Results
JIRA will simply close the issue creation screen, disregarding the white space

h3. Actual Results
JIRA displays the following warning:
 !warning.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* Reproducible in JIRA 6.4.14, 7.3.2
* Not reproducible in JIRA 6.3.15
fields.summary: JIRA should not display error if only white space is entered to issue creation form upon cancelling

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If JIRA is configured to use *Portuguese(Brazil)* as the main language, notifications sent through e-mail when creating accounts to users will have the introduction text in both Portuguese and English. This does not seems to be intended, as it was not replicable when using other languages (french and spanish for example).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set JIRA's main language to *Portuguese (Brazil)*.
# Got to the *User Settings* and create a new account.
# Select the option to *Send notification email* so that the user receives a notification about the creation of the account.

h3. Expected Results

The user should receive the notification with the text in the default language of the application.

h3. Actual Results

The message comes in both Portuguese and english, as seen below:
{noformat}
JIRA is the project tracker for teams building great software. Log in now to track your issues and tasks, collaborate with your team, and stay on top of project activity. O JIRA é o sistema de gestão de projetos para construir ótimo software. Logue-se agora para organizar suas tarefas, colaborar com seu time e ficar por dentro de toda a atividade do projeto.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
There's currently no known workaround for this.
fields.summary: Notification for account creation in pt-br comes in two languages

Vincent

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

When you perform a CSV containing issue information from the Issue Navigator, there is not information about which Time Zone the user that performed the export is in.

h3. Suggested Solution

Include a note on the exported file that shows the current time zone the user that created the file is in.

h3. Why this is important
 
This is important when sharing the document across multiple timezones - the way the import works not, users are not able to tell the exact time a event took place from simply checking the time of a custom field. Having the time zone will help in translating those times so that they make sense.
fields.summary: Display the time zone when export issues to a document.

fields.description:
h2.  Steps to reproduce
* install JIRA using the bin installer
* set the installation dir to "/usr/local/JIRA Core/"
* copy the response.var file a different server (see file)
* run the unattended installer.

h2. Actual Results
* service doesn't startup
*  the service wrapper script pointing to an incorrect path to jira installation dir (see file)

h2. Expected result

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When upgrading to JIRA 7.3.x or later, Internal with LDAP Auth (Delegated LDAP) directories that were configured to copy user on login, have the *Update User attributes on Login* setting checked automatically.  In the Directory Configuration Summary this is indicated as: {noformat}"crowd.delegated.directory.auto.update.user": "true"
{noformat}

However, in spite of this being true, users from that directory still allow for *Editing* from the *Users* page in Administration > User Management. 

h3. Environment
* Start with JIRA version prior to 7.3.0, with a Delegated LDAP Directory configured, with *Copy User on First Login* enabled.

For easier verification below, also have a user setup in the Delegated LDAP directory. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upgrade JIRA to 7.3.0 or later
# Navigate to {{⚙ (Administration) > User Management > User Directories}} and review the *Directory Configuration Summary*
** Verify that "crowd.delegated.directory.auto.update.user" is "true"
# Navigate to {{⚙ (Administration) > User Management > Users}} and *Edit* a user from the Delegated LDAP directory to mark it inactive. 

h3. Expected Results
The *Edit* link shouldn't even be displayed in the first place, per the text displayed when editing the Directory settings: 
bq. Users' attributes are updated from your LDAP server into JIRA when they authenticate. Selecting this means users can no longer be modified in JIRA.

See also: [Documentation Enhancement - "Update User attributes on Login" for Delegated LDAP Directories|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64040]

h3. Actual Results
You are able to mark a user from the Delegated LDAP directory as inactive in JIRA.
 
h3. Notes
May also relate to [JRASERVER-63697 - User did not get updated to Active/Inactive with Delegated LDAP|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63697]

h3.Workaround
*Edit* the Delegated Directory and immediately *Save* without making any changes.

This will correctly trigger the change and make users un-editable in JIRA.
fields.summary: After upgrade, Delegated LDAP directory users can be edited in JIRA in spite of "Update User attributes on Login" being checked

fields.summary: As a user I would like to sort components by header on the Project>Components page

fields.description:
When we look at the cached plan, we note that the PROD environment correctly uses the right index [dbo].[AO_60DB71_LEXORANK].[index_ao_60db71_lex1632828616], yet it still uses an index scan, effectively going through 193,945 rows!

Yet if you were to include a NOT NULL in the predicate, the expected seek index operation is used and the cost falls off dramatically with subtree costs of 24 to 3 (adding the NOT NULL predicate dropped it to 0.03).

It would seem that the way SQL Server is sniffing the values or not sniffing the values causes it to use the average of the histogram (where the value is null), rather than use the statistics itself (which happen to be 100% sample size).

So in this example, the answer to consistently achieve optimal performance is not an index but an added predicate to filter the NULL values!
fields.summary: Add a predicate to filter the NULL values

fields.description:
{panel:title=Update as of 7 May 2018}
Hello Everyone,

While we do not currently provide a standalone template we do support our products when they are deployed on AWS infrastructure providing the infrastructure deployed is meeting the minimum system requirements and the cause of any problems isn't specifically an AWS issue (like SSH keys or security groups, etc).

This suggestion is tracking updating our Supported Platforms to include these details.

Cheers!
The JIRA Server Team
{panel}



h3. Supported Platforms documentation is not clear regarding AWS

I want to host JIRA on a Windows or Linux system running on AWS EC2. I want to connect it to a supported database platform running on Amazon RDS. 

Looking at [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/supported-platforms-828787550.html/], it's not clear whether this is supported or if the whole of AWS is only supported for JIRA Data Center customers. 

h3. Suggested Solution

Clarify the [Supported platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver072/supported-platforms-828787550.html/] documentation to indicate that single-node EC2 OS instances and RDS hosted databases fall within the realm of "supported platforms."
fields.summary: Supported Platforms documentation is not clear regarding AWS

fields.description:
In order to create generic filters that work in any project, we would need a JQL function that refers to the current project in the browser page, just like we have a function like CurrentUser which refers to the current user.

We could then have a filter that would be like:

project = currentProject()

 
h2. Project

Search for issues that belong to a particular project. You can search by project name, by project key or by project ID (i.e. the number that JIRA automatically allocates to a project). In the rare case where there is a project whose project key is the same as another project's name, then the project key takes preference and hides results from the second project.
||Syntax|project|
||Field Type|PROJECT|
||Auto-complete|Yes|
||Supported operators|*{{= , !=}}*
*{{IS , IS NOT, IN , NOT IN}}*|
||Unsupported operators|*{{> , >= , < , <= ,}}* *{{~ , !~}}* 
*{{WAS, WAS IN, WAS NOT, WAS NOT IN , CHANGED}}* |
||Supported functions|When used with the *IN* and *NOT IN* operators, *{{project}}* supports: * projectsLeadByUser()
 * projectsWhereUserHasPermission()
 * projectsWhereUserHasRole()|
fields.summary: Add a function to JQL to refer to the current project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Support tool plugin doesn't support proxy authentication
h3. Environment
 * STP version *3.10.6*, other older versions were not tested
 * Java *8u111*+

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Configure JIRA with proxy auth, eg:
{code:java}
-Dhttp.proxyUser=test -Dhttp.proxyPassword=ping -Dhttp.proxyHost=172.16.47.128 -Dhttp.proxyPort=8080
{code}

 # Go to *Log analyzer* page, [ *Administration* > *System* > *Support Tools* ]

h3. Expected Results

STP is able authenticate at proxy and download xml from _confluence.atlassian.com_
(Specific URL: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/download/attachments/179443532/jira_regex_v2.xml])
h3. Actual Results
 * STP is *not able* authenticate at proxy.
 * You will get following error at UI:
 !log-analyzer_error.png|thumbnail! 
Error: _We couldn't run the log analyzer. There was a problem running the log analyze. You could try again by clicking Scan_

 * If you enable _INFO_ logging for {{com.atlassian.support}} classes (see JRASERVER-65278) you will get:
{code:java}
2017-05-11 09:53:12,200 hercules INFO admin 591x13519x2 aa 1.0.0.0 /plugins/servlet/stp/view/hercules/execute [c.a.s.tools.hercules.LogScanTask] Scan failed:
java.io.IOException: Unable to tunnel through proxy. Proxy returns "HTTP/1.1 407 Proxy Authentication Required"
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.doTunneling(HttpURLConnection.java:2124)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.connect(AbstractDelegateHttpsURLConnection.java:183)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream0(HttpURLConnection.java:1546)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.http.HttpURLConnection.getInputStream(HttpURLConnection.java:1474)
        at sun.net.www.protocol.https.HttpsURLConnectionImpl.getInputStream(HttpsURLConnectionImpl.java:254)
        at com.atlassian.sisyphus.RemoteXmlPatternSource.reload(RemoteXmlPatternSource.java:77)
        at com.atlassian.sisyphus.RemoteXmlPatternSource.<init>(RemoteXmlPatternSource.java:68)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.AbstractSupportApplicationInfo.getPatternSourceByURL(AbstractSupportApplicationInfo.java:263)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.salext.JiraApplicationInfo.getPatternSource(JiraApplicationInfo.java:151)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.hercules.LogScanTask.call(LogScanTask.java:52)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.hercules.LogScanTask.call(LogScanTask.java:24)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

h3. Notes

*RemoteXmlPatternSource* method uses *HttpURLConnection* method, which doesn't allow Proxy auth for Basic Auth by default.

JIRA will send following request to proxy:
{code:java}
CONNECT confluence.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1
User-Agent: Java/1.8.0_92
Host: confluence.atlassian.com
Accept: text/html, image/gif, image/jpeg, *; q=.2, */*; q=.2
Proxy-Connection: keep-alive
{code}
Expected request:
{code:java}
CONNECT confluence.atlassian.com:443 HTTP/1.1
Host: confluence.atlassian.com:443
User-Agent: Java/1.8.0_92
Proxy-Connection: Keep-Alive
Proxy-Authorization: Basic dGVzdDp0ZXN0
{code}
Note *Proxy-Authorization* header.
h5. Caused by

Changes in Java *8u111*:
from: [http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/8u111-relnotes-3124969.html]
 *Disable Basic authentication for HTTPS tunneling*:
{quote}In some environments, certain authentication schemes may be undesirable when proxying HTTPS. Accordingly, the Basic authentication scheme has been deactivated, by default, in the Oracle Java Runtime .. Now, proxies requiring Basic authentication when setting up a tunnel for HTTPS will no longer succeed by default. If required, this authentication scheme can be reactivated by removing Basic from the jdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes networking property, or by setting a system property of the same name to "" ( empty ) on the command line.
{quote}
Fix: Add to Java environment:
{code:java}
-Djdk.http.auth.tunneling.disabledSchemes=
{code}
See related KB: [Basic authentication fails for outgoing proxy in Java 8u111|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/KB/Basic+authentication+fails+for+outgoing+proxy+in+Java+8u111]
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Support tool plugin doesn't support proxy authentication

Inactive users are not counted in Groups page and this can lead to a misinformation for the Administrators. This is also not consistent with the details found in Users page.

fields.description:
h4. Summary of Issue

If a user does not have Browse User global permission, they cannot set or update the Component Lead.
h4. How to reproduce
 # Install a fresh instance of JIRA 7.3.6
 # Log in as *admin*
 ** Create a non-admin user *test1* which belongs to *jira-software-users* group which has *Browse Users* Global Permission
 ** Create a non-admin user *test2* which belongs to *jira-software-users* group which has *Browse Users* Global Permission
 ** Created a *Test Project* and added *test1* as *Project Administrator Role*
 # Log into JIRA as *test1*
 ** Navigated to *Project Settings* » *Components* » Added a new Component *User Interface*
 *** Typing in *test2* showed the User name in the drop down and I was able to select *test2* and make them the *Component Lead*
 # Log in as *admin*
 ** Removed *jira-software-users* from *Browse Users* global permission
 # Log into JIRA as *test1*
 ** Navigated to *Project Settings* » *Components* » Edited existing Component *User Interface*
 *** Type in *test1* as Component Lead and get *No Matches* as the drop down
 *** Pressing Enter with *test1* reverts the Component Lead to *test2*
 *** Clicking the mouse away with *test1* reverts the Component Lead to *test2*

Now, repeat the above with JIRA 7.1.x and it was possible to set the Component Lead without Browse User global permission. Under JIRA 7.1.x, the Component Lead appears to be a free text field (when Browse Users global permission was removed) and only validates the user when the Add/Update button was pressed.
h4. Expected Result

As per *Project Settings* » *Users and roles* » *Add users to a role* functionality, if a known Username is entered, the User Picker will show that user name and can be selected.
h4. Actual Result

*No Matches* is shown under the drop down and cannot set or update the Component Lead.
h4. Workaround for JIRA 7.3.6
 # It is possible to [update the Component Lead via the JIRA Rest API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+Update+a+Component+Lead+with+the+Rest+API] without Browse User global permission; or
 # Request Browse Users Global permission access from your JIRA Administrator for your user; or
 # Request the JIRA Administrator assistance to update the Component Lead
fields.summary: Cannot assign Component Lead without Browse User global permission

fields.description:
The ability to change the parent of a subtask is implemented as part of the Move permissioned workflow.  The Move Issue permission is defined as moving an issue from one project to another and is by default permissioned only at the project admin level.

the need to reparent a subtask is just a general user need within a project.  It should not be tied to this move permission.  As it is, general project users do not have access to this workflow that exists under the Move menu workflow on the subtask.

It would be better to have a more direct "Reparent" action under the action menu and not have this workflow under the Move action for subtasks.
fields.summary: Change Sub-task's parent workflow in wrong permission model

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA doesn't include logging for {{com.atlassian.support}}, {{com.atlassian.troubleshooting}} packages by default. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Do any action in STP

h3. Expected Results
Logging present in JIRA logs. 
For example:
* {{com.atlassian.support.tools.hercules.LogScanTask}}
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2017-05-10 17:48:01,257 hercules INFO admin 1066x97x2 k85kiv 127.0.0.1 /plugins/servlet/stp/view/hercules/execute [c.a.s.tools.hercules.LogScanTask] Scan failed:
java.lang.InterruptedException
        at com.atlassian.sisyphus.DefaultSisyphusPatternMatcher.matchLine(DefaultSisyphusPatternMatcher.java:95)
        at com.atlassian.sisyphus.DefaultSisyphusPatternMatcher.match(DefaultSisyphusPatternMatcher.java:78)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.hercules.LogScanTask.call(LogScanTask.java:57)
        at com.atlassian.support.tools.hercules.LogScanTask.call(LogScanTask.java:24)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
        at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
        at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}
* {{com.atlassian.support.healthcheck.DefaultSupportHealthCheckSupplier}} 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
2017-05-10 17:46:55,393 http-nio-8081-exec-8 DEBUG admin 1066x100x1 k85kiv 127.0.0.1 /rest/supportHealthCheck/1.0/check/process/ [c.a.support.healthcheck.DefaultSupportHealthCheckSupplier] Supplying health check from descriptor: com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-healthcheck-plugin:hsqlHealthCheck (jira.healthcheck.hsql.description)
{code}

another example 
{noformat}
2019-04-25 11:50:20,005 heartbeat-scheduler-0 INFO      [c.a.t.j.h.scheduler.impl.HeartbeatSchedulerImpl] Scheduling job with : JobConfig[jobRunnerKey=com.atlassian.troubleshooting.jira.healthcheck.schedu
ler.impl.HeartbeatSchedulerImpl,runMode=RUN_LOCALLY,schedule=Schedule[type=INTERVAL,intervalScheduleInfo=IntervalScheduleInfo[firstRunTime=null,intervalInMillis=10000]],parameters={}]
{noformat}

h3. Actual Results
No logging. 
 
h3. Notes
See related {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}}. 
Default level is *WARN*:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
...
# To turn more verbose logging on - change "WARN" to "DEBUG"
log4j.rootLogger=WARN, console, filelog, cloudAppender
...
log4j.logger.com.atlassian = WARN, console, filelog, cloudAppender
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian = false

log4j.logger.com.atlassian.jira = INFO, console, filelog, cloudAppender
log4j.additivity.com.atlassian.jira = false
...
{code}

h3.Workaround
Manually enable *DEBUG* logging for {{com.atlassian.support}} classes. This need to be done after each restart. 
# Navigate to [ *Administration* > *System* > *Logging & Profiling* ] 
# {{com.atlassian.support}} package is not present by default, so Click *Configure* logging level for another package. 
# Fill the form as follows:
#* Package name: {{com.atlassian.support}}
#* Logging Level: DEBUG

Or modify {{atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties}} and include {{com.atlassian.support}} logger 

same for {{com.atlassian.troubleshooting}} logger
{code:Java|borderStyle=solid}
log4j.logger.com.atlassian.troubleshooting  = INFO, console, filelog
{code}
fields.summary: JIRA doesn't log com.atlassian.support  messages by default

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
As per [JRASERVER-28748|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-28748], during the Project import, the Boards are not going to be imported hence the Sprints to Boards associations will be lost. 

After the project import, we can create the Boards manually or by using some third-party plugin, but this may break the reports. For example, reports such as Release Burndown will only show partial Sprints and some of it will appear missing. Querying the database will return all the missing Sprints. 

h3. Suggested Solution
During the Project import, provide a wizard where users can map the old Board from the source instance to the new board in the target instance.

h3. Workaround 
Login to JIRA database and run this SQL:
{noformat}
UPDATE "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" set "RAPID_VIEW_ID" = <new board ID> where "ID" in (<IDs of missing sprints>)
{noformat}
(i) Replace {{<new board ID>}} with the respective value. {{<IDs of missing sprints>}} should be in comma separated list.

(!) *Please test this on a [staging server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer071/Establishing+staging+server+environments+for+JIRA+applications] before updating your Production instance.*
fields.summary: Project import to allow JIRA Software Board mapping

fields.description:
h3. Description
During the integrity checking procedure, JIRA fired the following query to the database:
{code}
SELECT ID, pkey, issuenum, PROJECT, REPORTER, ASSIGNEE, CREATOR, issuetype, SUMMARY, DESCRIPTION, ENVIRONMENT, PRIORITY, RESOLUTION, issuestatus, CREATED, UPDATED, DUEDATE, RESOLUTIONDATE, VOTES, WATCHES, TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE, TIMEESTIMATE, TIMESPENT, WORKFLOW_ID, SECURITY, FIXFOR, COMPONENT FROM jiraissue
{code}
and load the data in the memory. For a large JIRA instance (more than 50 000 issues), loading such amount of data required a big chunk of heap that might cause the memory congestion or garbage collection performance issue.

h3. Suggestion
The result set should paged to limit the size of data to be loaded in the memory to avoid the any memory pressure.
fields.summary: The integrity checker is loading the entire JIRA issue table

fields.description:
h3. Summary
*IntegrityChecker* (/secure/admin/IntegrityChecker.jspa) may cause intensive JVM memory pressure and FullGC. At this stage this could be related only to {{com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC42ResultSet}} implementation. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7
* MySQL (other version was not reported to have the problem)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# _SelectAll_ and run *IntegrityChecker* 
# Monitor GC logs

h3. Expected Results
JIRA performs well and there is no impact for normal operations 

h3. Actual Results
Intensive memory allocation, frequent FullGC, checking GC log file will show the following:
{noformat}
2016-10-20T17:21:32.546+0100: 2279065.239: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  7825M->6321M(8192M), 10.9923741 secs]

2016-10-20T17:21:54.098+0100: 2279086.791: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  7799M->6331M(8192M), 8.0748878 secs]

2016-10-20T17:22:10.321+0100: 2279103.014: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  7856M->6352M(8192M), 11.1664467 secs]

2016-10-20T17:22:29.799+0100: 2279122.492: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  7826M->6510M(8192M), 11.0097723 secs]

2016-10-20T17:23:33.026+0100: 2279185.719: [Full GC (Allocation Failure)  7826M->6371M(8192M), 9.4332153 secs]
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
Heap dump will show large chunk of memory allocated to {{com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC42ResultSet}} :
{code:borderStyle=solid}
Class Name                                  | Shallow Heap | Retained Heap | Percentage
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC42ResultSet @ 0x6e2fe1ac8|          176 | 1,957,803,480 |     25.73%
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
{code}

or PieChart:
 !heap_JDBC42ResultSet_1.png|thumbnail! 

Please note {{com.mysql.jdbc.JDBC42ResultSet}} may be allocated by another JIRA (or plugin) function, this is not nessasary caused by *IntegrityChecker*. 

h3.Workaround
None
fields.summary: IntegrityChecker may cause intensive JVM memory pressure and FullGC

fields.description:
If you have users that the username start with zero and only contain numbers, you are not able to remove them from Project Roles through the interface.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a user like _01234_;
 # Edit a Project Role and add the user to a given role;
 # Try to remove the user by clicking on the trashcan icon.

h3. Expected Results

The user gets removed successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The user is not removed and no errors are displayed in the logs nor in the browser.
h3. Additional Information
 * It seems that the browsers are taking of the leading 0 and sending a request to remove the user _1234_ instead of _01234_.
 * This problem is reproducible with groupname which starts with "0" as well.

h3. Workaround
* Remove the user from project roles in JIRA administration > User Management instead
* Remove the user from Project Role using REST API, example:
{code:java}
curl -u username:password -X DELETE http://jira.aexmple.comi/rest/api/2/project/TEST/role/10002?user=01234
{code}
fields.summary: Unable to remove users and groups that start with 0 from the Project Roles

fields.description:
h3. Summary
During upgrade from JIRA 6.x to 7.x, JIRA need to execute set of upgrade tasks. 
One of them is *migrateCronTriggers* part of *UpgradeTask_Build70010* (this is one time upgrade task to migrate from _Quarts_ to _Cesium_).  This method throws NullPointerException (NPE) due to data inconsistency between {{jquartz_triggers}} and {{jquartz_cron_triggers}} tables. 

h3. Environment
* JIRA 6.4.14
* Upgrade to JIRA 7.2.8

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Start JIRA 7.2.8 with old 6.4.14 DB

h3. Expected Results
Upgrade works fine 

h3. Actual Results
Upgrade fails. 
Error: 
{noformat}
2017-05-05 23:58:06,519 localhost-startStop-1 ERROR      [c.a.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl] Exception thrown during upgrade: null

	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgrade(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:483)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeeded(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:425)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeManagerImpl.doUpgradeIfNeededAndAllowed(UpgradeManagerImpl.java:369)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.checkIfUpgradeNeeded(UpgradeLauncher.java:90)
	at com.atlassian.jira.upgrade.UpgradeLauncher.start(UpgradeLauncher.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.ActiveServicesLauncher.start(ActiveServicesLauncher.java:49)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postTenantArrived$4(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:178)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultInstantUpgradeManager$StartupTask.run(DefaultInstantUpgradeManager.java:139)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultInstantUpgradeManager.runTask(DefaultInstantUpgradeManager.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultInstantUpgradeManager.doNowOrWhenInstanceBecomesActive(DefaultInstantUpgradeManager.java:42)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postTenantArrived(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:171)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDBActivated$3(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.jira.tenancy.DefaultTenantManager.doNowOrWhenTenantArrives(DefaultTenantManager.java:55)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDBActivated(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:156)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$postDbLaunch$2(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:145)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrEnqueue(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:298)
	at com.atlassian.jira.config.database.DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.doNowOrWhenDatabaseActivated(DatabaseConfigurationManagerImpl.java:194)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.postDbLaunch(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:135)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.lambda$start$0(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:101)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.devspeed.JiraDevSpeedTimer.run(JiraDevSpeedTimer.java:31)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.DefaultJiraLauncher.start(DefaultJiraLauncher.java:99)
	at com.atlassian.jira.startup.LauncherContextListener.initSlowStuff(LauncherContextListener.java:149)

	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}
 
h3. Notes
In general we load: 
* *triggers* from {{jquartz_triggers}} table 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select trigger_name from jquartz_triggers where trigger_type = 'CRON'
{code}
* *cronTriggers*  from {{jquartz_cron_triggers}} table 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
select trigger_name, cron_expression, time_zone_id from jquartz_cron_triggers;
{code}
* We pick triggers from {{jquartz_cron_triggers}} table by _trigger_name_

h3.Workaround
* To verify the data integrity, run following SQLs: 
{code:borderStyle=solid}
// jquartz_triggers
select count(trigger_name) from jquartz_triggers where trigger_type = 'CRON';
// jquartz_cron_triggers
select count(trigger_name) from jquartz_cron_triggers;
{code}
* Normally *Count* should be the same.
* In case {{jquartz_triggers}} has more values, please run to find those records:
{code:borderStyle=solid}
// Show childless triggers: 
select trigger_name from jquartz_triggers where trigger_type = 'CRON' and trigger_name not in (select trigger_name from jquartz_cron_triggers);
{code}
* Delete childless records from {{jquartz_triggers}} table

fields.description:
Problem Definition:
For one of our customers they are trying to create custom role for a user that allow him to create custom events and notifications, would you please advise if this is applicable.
The user shouldn't be a JIRA Administrator.

Suggested Solution:
Add new permissions to allow users to edit notifications and events specific to that project.


Why this is important:
Currently only JIRA administrators can do this, it would be good to allow non-admin users to be able to carry on daily work with less privileges as possible.

Workaround:
Grant the user JIRA administrator privilege.

the current assignee function will show all people in a group or limited by permission "Assignable User". the challenge is if my team is 24x7, would be great to be able to assign the issue based on other custom field and able to assign only to people who currently login or access JIRA.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
It is not possible to manually select and delete individual items from both the *Mail queue* and *Error queue*.

In cases where is it no longer desired to send some emails, the only option is to either flush the entire *Mail queue* or *Error queue* or to delete (clean) all entries from the *Error queue*.

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement funcionality to allow to select specific items on both the *Mail queue* and *Error queue* prior to selecting the delete or flush option.
 
h3. Workaround
None.
fields.summary: As a user I want to be able to select individual items from the Mail Queue or Error Queue instead of flushing or deleting all items at once
Searching for a Confluence page when creating a new issue link fails to display all spaces

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
In the [Restoring a project from backup|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Restoring+a+project+from+backup] documentation, it does not explicitly mention that both the source and destination instances need to have matching plugin versions even if the plugins are not being used.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In a JIRA Data Center Environment, during replication of cache defined by plugin, webapp class loader is used to deserialize cache invalidation messages and not OSGi class loader associated with plugin's OSGi bundle. ClassNotFoundException can be seen in the logs.
{code:java}
java.rmi.ServerException: RemoteException occurred in server thread; nested exception is: 
	java.rmi.UnmarshalException: error unmarshalling arguments; nested exception is: 
	java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.softwareplant.util.lang.POJO (no security manager: RMI class loader disabled)
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastServerRef.dispatch(UnicastServerRef.java:355)
	at sun.rmi.transport.Transport$1.run(Transport.java:200)
	at sun.rmi.transport.Transport$1.run(Transport.java:197)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at sun.rmi.transport.Transport.serviceCall(Transport.java:196)
	at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport.handleMessages(TCPTransport.java:568)
	at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.run0(TCPTransport.java:826)
	at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.lambda$run$0(TCPTransport.java:683)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at sun.rmi.transport.tcp.TCPTransport$ConnectionHandler.run(TCPTransport.java:682)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
	at sun.rmi.transport.StreamRemoteCall.exceptionReceivedFromServer(StreamRemoteCall.java:276)
	at sun.rmi.transport.StreamRemoteCall.executeCall(StreamRemoteCall.java:253)
	at sun.rmi.server.UnicastRef.invoke(UnicastRef.java:162)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMICachePeer_Stub.remove(Unknown Source)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.replicateRemovalNotification(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:243)
	at net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.notifyElementRemoved(RMISynchronousCacheReplicator.java:229)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.internalNotifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:144)
	at net.sf.ehcache.event.RegisteredEventListeners.notifyElementRemoved(RegisteredEventListeners.java:124)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.notifyRemoveInternalListeners(Cache.java:2322)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.removeInternal(Cache.java:2305)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2207)
	at net.sf.ehcache.Cache.remove(Cache.java:2125)
	at net.sf.ehcache.constructs.EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.remove(EhcacheDecoratorAdapter.java:154)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.LoadingCache.remove(LoadingCache.java:208)
	at com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.DelegatingCache.remove(DelegatingCache.java:134)
{code}

h3. Expected Results

JIRA uses plugin's class loader to deserialize message. No exception is thrown.

h3. Environment
 * JIRA Data Center

h3. Workaround (for plugin developers)
 * Use keys that can be serialized/deserialized by webapp class loader (e.g. java.lang.String). (As long as loading cache is used and put() is not called on it, custom classes can be used as cache values).
 * NOT TESTED: Plugin developers may consider wrapping cache creation with a class loader switching code, to ensure that the right class loader is used.
{code:java}
ClassLoader previous = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
try {
   Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(CustomCacheKey.class.getClassLoader());
   // cache creation code
} finally {
   Thread.currentThread().setContextClassLoader(previous);
}
{code}
Cache usage does not have to be guarded this way.

h3. Workaround (for users)

None.
fields.summary: Plugin caches in Data Center throw ClassNotFoundException on invalidation if custom classes are used as keys

fields.description:
The attached picture demonstrates the problem. The Bitbucket project has a few repositories and only the prefix of the repositories (which are all the same) is visible. This leads to incorrect branches being made due to hitbox selection missing or user error in selection.

For example, a user wants to select Project1_ABCDEFG_Source vs. Project2_ABCDEFG_Tests
The user selects the drop down and thinks they have selected one over the other. There is no actual confirmation of this in the final selection window (as attached) so an incorrect unnecessary branch is created. This wastes space and time as the user thinks they have the branch they need but a bogus branch was created.

 

By allowing the drop-down selections to scale larger this would be avoided most likely. The attached picture emphasizes the point as it is an ultra widescreen and shows a lot of wasted space. Even on an HD screen or lower def there is plenty of space to show more characters, however.

 

Thanks,

Jijo
fields.summary: Please Scale the drop downs for branching from JIRA so they are visible

fields.description: When I search for a user, the search shows a list of users sorted alphabetically by name. If you type an exact username, it would be nice if the user with that username was sorted first. This is especially important for users where their username is a proper subset of another username or name.
fields.summary: Full name search is prioritized over exact username match

fields.description:
Using stash you can issue a pull request and have code reviews and you can configure stash to allow a particular pull request to be merged once meeting a number of approvals. 

 

Why can't we have that for JIRA ticket creation as well? There have been times where a pull request was issued and comments are left only by the author of the JIRA was looking for particular coordination, approaches or details after the pull request had been issued. It would certainly be beneficial if we could have a JIRA queue of tickets awaiting approvals. This queue would just be a way for others to see if all the details had been filled out.
fields.summary: There should be a peer-review process for creation of tickets in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a screen reader, the options on Combo Box fields  (such as Fix Version, Priority, or Labels) are not read out loud.

Here is a quick video of a field that works (Linked Issues) vs fields that do not work. Audio was not recorded, so see the top bar for what is being read:

[^combo_box_issue.mov]
h3. Environment

JIRA being used with a screen reader, such as OSX VoiceReader, JAWS, or NVDA.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Activate VoiceOver in OS X (⌘+F5).
 # Create or edit an issue in JIRA.
 # Mouse over some options in a Combo Box field, and note that they are not read out loud.

h3. Expected Results

The options will be read out loud.
h3. Actual Results

Instead of the options being read, the Screen Reader reports:
{quote}You are currently on a combo box, inside of HTML content. Type text or, to display a list of choices, press Control-Option-Space. To exit this web area, press Control-Option-Shift-Up Arrow
{quote}
Or on some browsers it will not report anything at all.
fields.summary: Screen Readers Cannot Read Combo Box Options
cursor is blocked to click by tooltip, please see attachment

fields.description:
h3. *Summary*

Applying format in middle of a word does not work when creating an Issue at JIRA.
h3. *Steps to Reproduce*
 # Hit the 'Create' button.
 # Write in the comment field or any text area.
 # Apply format (bold/italic/underline) to characters in the middle/a section of the word(s).
 # Hit 'Save' button.

h3. *Expected Results*

The issue is created, having text in its description with bold/italic/underline format.
h3. *Actual Results*

The issue is created with the text showing markup language instead of the bold/italic/underline format.
h3. *Notes*
 * This was tested in visual tab, once using only the UI buttons to apply the format, a second time using only markup language and third time using both.
 * No change or play between Visual and Text tab was used.
 * Tested in Chrome and MS Edge.
 * Tested with the WYSIWYG ON and OFF.
 * Example: h*er*e

h3. *Workaround*

No workaround at the moment.
fields.summary: Applying format in middle of a word does not work when creating an Issue at JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When creating a Created vs Resolved report via the gadget. There is no option to configure or change the date range of when it will display. It will always display the last few months. 

 !image-2017-05-04-19-53-40-132.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow the date range to be configured.

h3. Why this is important
There are scenarios where the user will interested in checking the report across a specific date range. In this example provided by the screenshot, the user had created a filter for issues created and resolved in 2013 but is unable to track them via the gadget.
fields.summary: Created Vs Resolved Gadget should allow the date range to be modified

fields.description:
h2. Problem

If a user replies to an email thread that encompasses multiple projects, the comment will only be appended to a single project.
h2. Steps to reproduce
 - Create email handlers of type "Create a new issue or add a comment to an existing issue" for two projects (Project One, Project Two) with different email addresses.
 - Send a single email to both project email addresses (project1@example.com, project2@example.com) to create issues (P1-1,P2-1) in both projects
 - Reply-all to the email thread to append a comment to the created issues

h2. Expected Results

The reply-all comment should be appended to both issues
h2. Actual Results

1) If replying-all, The comment is appended twice to the issue in Project One and not at all to the issue in Project Two.
 2) If you remove project1@example.com and reply ONLY to project2@example.com, the comment is still appended only to the issue in Project One and not to Project Two.
h2. Additional data
 - State of notificationinstance table after initial ticket creation (source 10109 = issue created in Project One, source 10110 = issue created in Project Two)

fields.description:
We are using a simple url rewrite rule for our renamed jira host.
After hours of analyzation, we recognized an issue in the tuckey urlrewriter.

The query string is replaced wrongly. The "?" is replaced by an "&".

In our current Jira version 7.3.3 we discovered Tuckey Urlrewriter 4.0.3.

The issue was fixed later in commit https://github.com/paultuckey/urlrewritefilter/commit/8047d4f3cbc7e0a890b24b9c60d9fdf526963e85, see issue:
https://github.com/paultuckey/urlrewritefilter/issues/116\\ 
The target release with this fix would be 4.0.5, but, unfortunately, there is still no release.

As a workaround, I created a tuckey urlrewriter release by myself and copied the jar file into the lib directory for testing - our rule worked and the query string was appended and replaced correctly, then.

Is it possible for you to integrate this fix into Jira?

For reference, you could take a look at my test release:
https://github.com/tirolerstefan/urlrewritefilter/releases/tag/urlrewritefilter-4.0.3-1\\ 
For details about reproduction, look at attached file.

{code}
--- Url Rewrite Rule (urlrewrite.xml) ---

    <rule enabled="true">
        <name>Redirection to besjira-test.eu.besi.corp</name>
        <condition name="host" operator="notequal">^besijira-test.eu.besi.corp</condition>
        <condition name="host" operator="notequal">^localhost</condition>

        <from>^/(.*)</from>
        <to type="permanent-redirect" last="true" qsappend="true">http://besijira-test.eu.besi.corp/$1</to>
   </rule>



--- With urlrewritefilter 4.0.3 ---

=> "abc&x=1&y=2"

$ wget --no-proxy -S -O /dev/null 'http://onejira-test.eu.besi.corp/abc?x=1&y=2'
--2017-05-03 06:43:27--  http://onejira-test.eu.besi.corp/abc?x=1&y=2
Resolving onejira-test.eu.besi.corp (onejira-test.eu.besi.corp)... 10.10.9.226
Connecting to onejira-test.eu.besi.corp (onejira-test.eu.besi.corp)|10.10.9.226|:80... connected.
HTTP request sent, awaiting response... 
  HTTP/1.1 301 
  Date: Wed, 03 May 2017 04:43:28 GMT
  Server: Apache/2.4.7 (Ubuntu)
  X-AREQUESTID: 403x6x1
  X-ASEN: SEN-2072038
  Location: http://besijira-test.eu.besi.corp/abc&x=1&y=2
  Content-Type: text/html;charset=UTF-8
  Content-Length: 0
  Keep-Alive: timeout=5, max=100
  Connection: Keep-Alive
Location: http://besijira-test.eu.besi.corp/abc&x=1&y=2 [following]



--- With urlrewritefilter 4.0.3-1 ---
(https://github.com/tirolerstefan/urlrewritefilter/releases/tag/urlrewritefilter-4.0.3-1)

=> "abc?x=1&y=2"

$ wget --no-proxy -S -O /dev/null 'http://onejira-test.eu.besi.corp/abc?x=1&y=2'

fields.description:
Hi team,

Our teams are requesting that the 'Project' field that gets auto-filled while creating an issue be standard - i.e making the same project show up whenever an issue is created - perhaps a 'default project' that can be set on the user profile level.

At the moment, JIRA fills in the project field (when attempting to create an issue) based on the project the last viewed issue belongs to. So, if the user looks at an issue (e.g ABC-123) belonging to project (ABC)  he does not work on, then goes on to create an issue, the project field in the issue create screen automatically gets filled in as the project name of project ABC.

NOTE: We are seeing this behavior in Jira 6.4.14. If the behavior is different  (I.e if the default project is configurable in Jira 7.3), please could you let us know and close this request. If the behavior in 7.3 is the same as what we are seeing in 6.4.14, please consider this as an RFC.
fields.summary: 'Default Project' as a user profile selectable option
Bump JIM plugin tests dependency on JIRA REST Java client

fields.description:
hi There,

I have a over 50 of Dashboards in JIRA that are cloned to generate similar paged using a different customer. I need to share those with same JIRA group e.g. "managers". With current JIRA behavior, I need to individually click the three dots icon on the right and change the share permission and wait for the page to refresh. It takes 10-15 seconds for each Dashboards. It is very annoying. What if there is a Multi Edit option page for editing permissions or name for Dashboards..

Thank You,

Parminder Sandhu
fields.summary: Multi edit option page for Dashboards e.g. sharing permissions for Dashboard, editing Dashboard name

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, we don't have an official documentation for the following JQL search property for fusion data like below:
||Field Name||Meaning||Product||
|commits|The number of commits for the issue|Bitbucket Cloud or Bitbucket  / FishEye|
|failingbuilds|The number of failing builds for the branch|Bamboo|
|openprs|The number of open pull requests|Bitbucket Cloud or Bitbucket |
|openreviews|The number of open code reviews (in Crucible)|Crucible|
|prs|The total number of pull requests|Bitbucket Cloud or Bitbucket |
|reviews|The total number of code reviews|Crucible|
|staleAfter|The time at which the dev panel data will expire (not super useful to you)| All products|

JQL query example:
{code:java}
project = "ABC" and issue.property[development].<field_name> > 0
{code}
h3. Suggested Solution

As an admin user, it would be great to be the same as our workflow properties doco:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/workflow-properties-802592825.html]

Or compile the JQL query information in our JQL advanced doco:
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-764478330.html]

Or under the Integrating with development tools page:

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver073/integrating-with-development-tools-867028207.html]
fields.summary: Documentation for JQL search for fusion data
